result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craige Travis Wilkerson Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Craige Travis Wilkerson Jr not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Craige Travis Wilkerson Jr.  
Attorney Dax Odom in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Court waived defendant's appearance due to his in custody status.
Defense request a plea and sentencing date. 
Defense advised to file the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing,. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Craige Travis Wilkerson Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Craige Travis Wilkerson Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Dax Odom in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense is not in receipt of all discovery. Defense requests an additional status conference date. Court grants defenses request. Case adjourned to Branch 19.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.
Per email with the parties Status Conference has been moved from 9-8-2022 to September 15, 2022 at 8:30am.

Defendant Craige Travis Wilkerson not in court, defendant in custody. Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case calendared for a Status of Counsel. Defendant in custody at CJF. Case passed for defendant to be produced by zoom. 
Case recalled at 10:06am. Defendant unable to be produced by zoom at this time. Parties notified SPD Office need addtional time to appoint counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel. Case remains calendared in Branch 19. Status Conference scheduled Septembe 8, 2022 at 1:30pm.

Defendant Craige Travis Wilkerson in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Craige Travis Wilkerson in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Kelly Hedge.    Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for status of counsel.    Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court, defendant Craige Travis Wilkerson not in court, in custody.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is refusing to appear in court. Defense is moving to withdraw. Case is adjourned in Branch 45.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (14 pages) commencing 04-07-22 by CASSANDRA HALL.
Received and Filed.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court, defendant Craige Travis Wilkerson not in court, in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for Jason Findling for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail bond hearing. Bail motion by defense argued and DENIED by the Court. All conditions remain the same. Defense requested a scheduling conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Discharge Report

Defendant Craige Travis Wilkerson in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Craige Travis Wilkerson in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: P.O. Jeremy Kenner - MPD.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense request to be heard as to bail.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjustment made on Courts own motion. All other conditions remains as previously set.

10:28 AM Attorney Jason A Findling in court by video, defendant Craige Travis Wilkerson not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense moves to dismiss; motion is taken under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order and limited curfew (8 pm - 7 am). 
If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with Alexander B.; Rashaun B.; April L.; Carol P.; and CVS Pharmacy - 1650 N Farwell Ave
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Craige Travis Wilkerson in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Craige Travis Wilkerson in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Craige Travis Wilkerson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense withheld NOT GUILTY plea until Preliminary Hearing.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
